stress: I really [hope] to [become] a [senior] [developer] someday. Do you [recommend] taking any specific [courses]?
ipa: aɪ ˈɹɪli ˈhoʊp tə bɪˈkʌm ə ˈsinjɚ dəˈvɛləpɚ ˈsʌmˌdeɪ. du jə ˌɹɛkəˈmɛnd ˈteɪkɪŋ ˈɛni spəˈsɪfɪk ˈkɔɹsɪz
linking:
"hope to" → /hoʊp tə/ (to reduced)
"to become" → /tə bɪˈkʌm/ (smooth link)
"do you" → /du jə/ (you reduced)
"taking any" → /ˈteɪkɪn ˈɛni/ (drop g)

stress: Definitely. I usually [suggest] [focusing] on [backend] [skills] first. Also, don't [put] off [applying] for small [freelance] [jobs] — they [help] a lot.
ipa: ˈdɛfənətli. aɪ ˈjuʒəˌli səˈdʒɛst ˈfoʊkəsɪŋ ɑn ˈbækˌɛnd skɪlz fɝst. ˈɔlsoʊ doʊnt pʊt ɔf əˈplaɪɪŋ fɚ smɔl ˈfriˌlæns ʤɑbz — ðeɪ hɛlp ə lɑt
linking:
"suggest focusing" → /səˈdʒɛst ˈfoʊkəsɪŋ/ (smooth link)
"put off applying" → /pʊt ɔf əˈplaɪɪŋ/ (linking off + applying)
"freelance jobs" → /ˈfriˌlæns ʤɑbz/ (smooth connection)

stress: Got it. I [plan] to [start] a few side [projects] too. Do you [mind] [reviewing] them once they're [done]?
ipa: gɑt ɪt. aɪ plæn tə stɑɹt ə fju saɪd ˈprɑˌʤɛkts tu. du jə maɪnd ɹɪˈvjuɪŋ ðɛm wʌns ðɛɹ dʌn
linking:
"plan to start" → /plæn tə stɑɹt/ (to reduced)
"mind reviewing" → /maɪnd ɹɪˈvjuɪŋ/ (link d + reviewing)
"once they're done" → /wʌns ðɛɹ dʌn/ (smooth transition)

stress: Not at all! In fact, I [enjoy] [helping] [younger] [developers] [grow]. Also, [try] to [contribute] to [open-source] [projects] if you can.
ipa: nɑt ət ɔl. ɪn fækt aɪ ɛnˈʤɔɪ ˈhɛlpɪŋ ˈjʌŋɡɚ dəˈvɛləpɚz ɡɹoʊ. ˈɔlsoʊ tɹaɪ tə kənˈtɹɪbjut tu ˈoʊpən sɔɹs ˈprɑˌʤɛkts ɪf jʊ kæn
linking:
"enjoy helping" → /ɛnˈʤɔɪ ˈhɛlpɪŋ/ (smooth link)
"try to contribute" → /tɹaɪ tə kənˈtɹɪbjut/ (to reduced)
"open-source" → /ˈoʊpən sɔɹs/ (smooth)

stress: That [sounds] [exciting]. I [imagine] [working] with [big] [teams] could be [challenging] though.
ipa: ðæt saʊndz ɪkˈsaɪtɪŋ. aɪ ɪˈmæʤɪn ˈwɝkɪŋ wɪð bɪɡ timz kʊd bi ˈʧælənʤɪŋ ðoʊ
linking:
"imagine working" → /ɪˈmæʤɪn ˈwɝkɪŋ/ (smooth link)
"big teams" → /bɪɡ timz/ (link g + t lightly)
"could be challenging" → /kʊd bi ˈʧælənʤɪŋ/ (link could + be)

stress: True, but if you [learn] to [collaborate] well, you’ll [love] it. And remember to [avoid] [neglecting] your [soft] [skills] — they’re just as [important].
ipa: tɹu bət ɪf jʊ lɝn tə kəˈlæbəˌɹeɪt wɛl. jʊl lʌv ɪt. ænd ɹɪˈmɛmbɚ tə əˈvɔɪd nəˈɡlɛktɪŋ jɚ sɔft skɪlz — ðɛɹ ʤəst æz ɪmˈpɔɹtənt
linking:
"learn to collaborate" → /lɝn tə kəˈlæbəˌɹeɪt/ (to reduced)
"avoid neglecting" → /əˈvɔɪd nəˈɡlɛktɪŋ/ (smooth link)
"soft skills" → /sɔft skɪlz/ (t links smoothly)

stress: Thanks! Sometimes I [feel] like [giving] up when I [hit] [bugs] I can’t [solve].
ipa: θæŋks. ˈsʌmˌtaɪmz aɪ fil laɪk ˈɡɪvɪŋ ʌp wɛn aɪ hɪt bʌɡz aɪ kænt sɑlv
linking:
"feel like giving" → /fil laɪk ˈɡɪvɪŋ/ (link feel + like)
"hit bugs" → /hɪt bʌɡz/ (t links into bugs)

stress: Trust me, we all do. Just [keep] [practicing] and you’ll [get] there [faster] than you [think].
ipa: tɹʌst mi, wi ɔl du. ʤəst kip ˈpræktɪsɪŋ ənd jʊl ɡɛt ðɛɹ ˈfæstɚ ðæn jʊ θɪŋk
linking:
"keep practicing" → /kip ˈpræktɪsɪŋ/ (smooth link)
"and you’ll" → /ənd jʊl/ (and reduced)
"get there" → /ɡɛt ðɛɹ/ (link t to there)
